feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Dense Smoke Advisory issued June 28 at 10:11AM AKDT until June 29 at 1:00PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...DENSE SMOKE ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 PM AKDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Visibility less than one mile in dense smoke. * WHERE...Central Interior. * WHEN...Until 1 PM AKDT Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Hazardous driving conditions due to low visibility and poor air quality.

entry.title: Dense Smoke Advisory issued June 28 at 10:11AM AKDT until June 29 at 1:00PM AKDT by NWS

entry.title: Hydrologic Outlook issued June 27 at 1:58PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...POTENTIAL FLOODING OF AREA RIVERS DUE TO ABOVE NORMAL TEMPERATURES... Very warm and well above normal temperatures are expected to continue into mid week. These near record high temperatures will increase snow and ice melt and subsequent water-levels of area rivers including the Chilkat, Klehini, and Taiya.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Haines Borough and Lynn Canal; Taiya Inlet and Klondike Highway

entry.title: Flood Statement issued June 28 at 6:29AM SST by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT THROUGH 8 AM... WHAT...Minor flooding resulting from heavy rainfall WHERE...Tutuila ma Aunu`u WHEN...Through 8 AM IMPACTS...Heavy rainfall and runoff may cause elevated stream and drainage ditch levels. Ponding may occur on roads and low lying areas.

entry.title: High Surf Advisory issued June 27 at 9:30PM SST by NWS
entry.summary: ...A High Surf Advisory remains in effect... * SURF...Surf heights of 11 to 14 feet will continue to impact south and east facing shores. * TIMING...through Tuesday * IMPACTS...high surfs and strong rip currents Fautuaga mo galu maualuluga
entry.cap:areaDesc: Manua; Swains Island; Tutuila and Aunuu

entry.title: Flood Warning issued June 25 at 11:10AM MDT until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in South Dakota... James River At Ashton affecting Spink County. James River near Stratford affecting Brown and Spink Counties. entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 28 at 2:01PM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central San Patricio County through 230 PM CDT... At 200 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Sinton, moving southwest at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 28 at 1:39PM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Jeff Davis County through 230 PM CDT... At 139 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 10 miles south of Kent, moving northwest at 5 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 28 at 12:56PM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Garfield and southeastern Uintah Counties through 130 PM MDT... At 1255 PM MDT, satellite imagery indicated a strong thunderstorm 34 miles northwest of Fruita, or 43 miles northwest of Grand Junction, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 28 at 12:55PM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of through 130 PM MDT... At 1254 PM MDT, Doppler radar and satellite were tracking a slow moving thunderstorm 20 miles northwest of Blanding. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail.

entry.title: Rip Current Statement issued June 28 at 9:24AM AST until June 29 at 6:00PM AST by NWS
entry.summary: ...HIGH RIP CURRENT RISK REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Dangerous rip currents expected due to breaking waves of 5 to 8 feet. * WHERE...Beaches along the North Central to Northwestern coast of Puerto Rico from Aguadilla to Dorado. Beaches of eastern Saint Croix.
